item.title: Darkside Malware
item.author: pco2001w@gmail.com (ByridianBlack)
item.description: Darkside is a ransomware notorious for attacking high profile industrial control systems and facilities.

item.title: Discord Troll Malware
item.author: pco2001w@gmail.com (ByridianBlack)
item.description: Discord for the past few years has been known to be a hub for spreading malware and while they have done much to crack down on this spread the problem is still prevalent.

item.title: DiffuseGravity
item.author: pco2001w@gmail.com (ByridianBlack)
item.description: Introduction VB6 compiler can be treated as a packer because of its translation from what is known as P code into assembly code.

item.title: Invicea Tunnel Malware Analysis
item.author: pco2001w@gmail.com (ByridianBlack)
item.description: Initial Analysis & Outside Research Not much is known about this malware or at least not much research has been done on it.

item.title: VBS Dropper Script for Nanocore RAT. Fileless Properties.
item.author: pco2001w@gmail.com (ByridianBlack)
item.description: Introduction This piece of malware had some fileless malware properties but because it copied itself to disk it cannot be categorized as a fileless malware.

item.title: Poweliks Malware Analysis
item.author: pco2001w@gmail.com (ByridianBlack)
item.description: Introduction As of recent I have been interested in fileless malware and the different approaches authors have when executing them.

item.title: VBS APT34 Dropper Analysis
item.author: pco2001w@gmail.com (ByridianBlack)
item.description: Introduction VBS scripts are malicious codes that can contain PowerShell commands which can have serious damage on the victim machine.

item.title: Win32/InfoStealer Dexter Malware
item.author: pco2001w@gmail.com (ByridianBlack)
item.description: Introduction Win32/InfoStealer.Dexter is part of a family of malware with the purpose of stealing information such as credit card numbers, passwords or various techniques.
